column4: yes.  /media instead of /mnt/.  This won't fix your current problem but you might as well get that right in the first place.
collier the error message from mount means that the file /dev/sdb1 doesn't exist.  Repeating the command won't make the file re-appear.

You need to find out why that device file wasn't created when you installed or when you booted (some systems run a script that auto-creates/deletes these files on each boot -- I forget what Ubuntu does)
generally, if the device driver isn't loaded, the file in /dev/ won't exist.
